author: @onlymyhealth
title: Have You Overcome Breast Cancer? Expert Shares Suggestions To Enhance Quality Of Life Post Treatment
text: Have you overcome breast cancer? If so, we have some valuable suggestions to enhance your quality of life post-treatment. The impact of breast cancer on your daily routine can vary based on its stage and the type of treatment being administered. Living with breast cancer is an unrelenting battle that can impact every aspect of a person's life. The physical toll of treatments such as chemotherapy and radiation, coupled with the emotional strain of facing mortality, can be overwhelming. ‚ÄúWomen often struggle to maintain a sense of normalcy while dealing with the uncertainty and fear that come with a cancer diagnosis. One of the lesser-discussed challenges of living with breast cancer is the strain it puts on relationships. Family dynamics may shift as loved ones try to offer support while grappling with their fears and emotions,‚Äù said Dr Tejal Gorasia, Medical Director, Onco Life Cancer Center, Satara, adding, this can leave individuals feeling isolated when they need connection and understanding the most. Despite these immense challenges, many women find strength in their journey through breast cancer. Each woman's response to diagnosis and therapy is unique, with a range of support options available for those in need. Essential tips for women living with breast cancer Stay stress-free ‚ÄúOne vital health tip for women [ living with breast cancer](https://www.onlymyhealth.com/risk-reducing-mastectomy-can-reduce-risk-of-breast-cancer-1708665402) is to prioritise self-care and mental well-being. It's crucial to acknowledge and address the emotional impact of the diagnosis, seeking support from loved ones or a therapist if needed. Embracing mindfulness practices such as meditation or yoga can also help manage stress and anxiety levels during treatment,‚Äù said Dr Gorasia. Also read: [Did You Know Breastfeeding Benefits Mothers As Much As Babies? Know From Doctor](https://www.onlymyhealth.com/benefits-of-breastfeeding-to-mothers-and-babies-1708956440) Eat Balanced Diet Dr Gorasia advises to focus on eating a balanced diet including fruits, vegetables, pulses, lentils, and whole grains. Proper nutrition plays a significant role in supporting the immune system and overall well-being throughout the treatment process. Stay Physically Active Staying physically active within personal limits can help boost energy levels, reduce fatigue, and improve mental well-being. Consulting with your doctor for personalised advice on exercise routines tailored to one‚Äôs needs is recommended. Recovery and follow-ups are important Navigating life after a breast cancer diagnosis can be a challenging and emotional journey. The recovery process involves not only physical healing from treatments like surgery, chemotherapy, and radiation but also emotional healing from the trauma of facing mortality. Women need to focus on self-care during this time, including getting enough rest, eating well-balanced meals, and seeking support from loved ones and mental health professionals. Also read: [Mastectomy May Reduce Breast Cancer Mortality: Study](https://www.onlymyhealth.com/risk-reducing-mastectomy-can-reduce-risk-of-breast-cancer-1708665402) Following up with regular check-ups and screenings is crucial in monitoring any potential recurrence or new developments. It is common for fear of cancer returning to linger in the minds of survivors. Staying proactive about one's health can provide a sense of empowerment and control. The take-home message Living with breast cancer can be challenging, but staying healthy is important in managing the disease. Following your doctor's advice is essential for a successful treatment and recovery journey. From maintaining a balanced diet to engaging in regular physical activity, taking care of your overall well-being is vital. Each woman‚Äôs experience with cancer is unique, so it's important to listen to your body and communicate openly with your doctor. Embrace a positive mindset and believe in your ability to overcome obstacles towards better health.

author: Ground News
title: Ground News - Philipsburg-Osceola Middle School celebrates Pi Day
text: CLEARFIELD COUNTY, Pa. (WTAJ) ‚Äì Philipsburg-Osceola Middle School students celebrated Pi Day with fun activities and lessons. Pi Day is an annual celebration of the mathematical constant known as Pi (3.14...) and is observed on March 14 (3/14) since three, one and four are the first three figures. Philipsburg-Osceola Middle School Celebrates Pi Day on an annual basis. title: '√â mais do mesmo', M√©xico critica plano dos EUA sobre fechamento de fronteira - Not√≠cias - BOL
text: '√â mais do mesmo', M√©xico critica plano dos EUA sobre fechamento de fronteira O presidente do M√©xico, Andr√©s Manuel L√≥pez Obrador, criticou, nesta quinta-feira (1¬∫), um projeto de lei dos Estados Unidos que autorizaria o governo a fechar a fronteira binacional se a situa√ß√£o migrat√≥ria estiver em colapso. "√â mais do mesmo, n√£o querem ir ao fundo" da quest√£o, disse L√≥pez Obrador em sua entrevista coletiva habitual, ressaltando que a "manipula√ß√£o" em torno dos temas migrat√≥rio e do tr√°fico de drogas √© uma constante nos Estados Unidos em tempos eleitorais. O projeto de lei est√° sendo negociado entre um grupo de congressistas republicanos e funcion√°rios governamentais, no momento em que a crise migrat√≥ria est√° no centro da agenda eleitoral e quando se vislumbra uma revanche pela Casa Branca entre o atual presidente Joe Biden e seu antecessor Donald Trump em novembro. As negocia√ß√µes partid√°rias t√™m como objetivo salvar o pacote de ajuda √† Ucr√¢nia solicitado por Biden ao Congresso, mas que os conservadores condicionam a um endurecimento da pol√≠tica migrat√≥ria diante dos n√∫meros recorde de imigrantes e solicitantes de asilo interceptados na fronteira de 3.200 km. "Por que se ajuda com gasto b√©lico, com bilh√µes de d√≥lares nas guerras, e n√£o podem destinar recursos para o progresso, para o bem-estar das popula√ß√µes pobres?", questionou o presidente mexicano, ao reiterar que a migra√ß√£o ilegal somente pode ser contida se suas causas forem resolvidas. N√£o √© uma op√ß√£o, uma alternativa", apontou o governante mexicano, que mant√©m boas rela√ß√µes tanto com Biden quanto com Trump, a quem chama de "amigos". author: malinga
title: Only President capable of solving economic crisis - Kesbewa UNP Zonal organiser - DailyNews
text: Kesbewa UNP organiser Ranil Willaddarage said on Tuesday that President Ranil Wickremesinghe who managed the economic crisis in the country successfully should be made President. Willaddarage also said that he has over 15 year experience as an entrepreneur and he is striving to make President Wickremesinghe victorious at the forthcoming Presidential election. He said so at the opening of his election office at Thumbowila in Piliyandala. He said that the country needs a new political culture devoid of party politics to get the country out of the present crisis. Willaddarage added that the politicians divided the people into parties and these parties hurled accusations at each other since independence. ‚ÄúThe country did not benefit. We need a new political culture devoid of divisions‚Äù, he added. He said that the President managed the crisis in the country very well. In the last two years, we saw how the President dealt with the precipitous situation in the country as a leader and as an entrepreneur, not as a politician. ‚ÄúI am starting my political journey today with the experience I have gained from working as a businessman for almost 15 years‚Äù. He said that the people should decide whether the country is handed over to a leader who has a vision for the development of the country or a leader who lacks experience in steering the country in a crisis.

author: En May√∫scula
title: La guerra sigue en Gaza e Israel reanuda las negociaciones - En May√∫scula
text: La guerra sigue en Gaza e Israel reanuda las negociaciones Franja de Gaza (Territorios Palestinos) (AFP) - Israel reanud√≥ este jueves en El Cairo las negociaciones indirectas que buscan una tregua en Gaza y la liberaci√≥n de los rehenes en manos del movimiento islamista Ham√°s, en el poder en ese territorio palestino devastado por m√°s de diez meses de guerra. Estas negociaciones se producen una semana despu√©s de las conversaciones mantenidas en Doha por los mediadores estadounidenses, catar√≠es y egipcios con el jefe del Mosad (la agencia de inteligencia exterior de Israel), David Barnea, y el jefe del Shin Bet (la agencia de seguridad interior), Ronen Bar. El portavoz del primer ministro israel√≠ Benjamin Netanyahu, Omer Dostri, indic√≥ que Barnea y Bar se encuentran actualmente en El Cairo, donde 'negocian para avanzar en un acuerdo para [liberar a] los rehenes' secuestrados el 7 de octubre durante el ataque de Ham√°s en el sur de Israel, que desencaden√≥ la guerra. Dostri no precis√≥ quien estaba presente en las conversaciones en la capital egipcia, pero los medios israel√≠es aseguran que hab√≠a representantes de Washington. El presidente de Estados Unidos, Joe Biden, insisti√≥ el mi√©rcoles en la urgencia de alcanzar un alto el fuego en Gaza y una liberaci√≥n de los rehenes durante una conversaci√≥n telef√≥nica con Netanyahu. El jefe de la diplomacia estadounidense, Antony Blinken, concluy√≥ ese d√≠a su novena gira por Medio Oriente desde el inicio de la guerra y anunci√≥ que hab√≠a propuesto un nuevo plan de compromiso para una tregua, cuyos detalles no se hicieron p√∫blicos, y que Israel lo hab√≠a aceptado. - 'Corredor Filadelfia' - Sin embargo, Israel todav√≠a no anunci√≥ p√∫blicamente su aprobaci√≥n de la propuesta estadounidense, que Ham√°s rechaz√≥ denunciando que se a√±adieron 'nuevas condiciones', relacionadas en particular con el mantenimiento de tropas israel√≠es en la frontera de Gaza con Egipto (una banda denominada 'corredor Filadelfia'). 'El primer ministro [Netanyahu] sostiene el principio de que Israel debe controlar el corredor Filadelfia para impedir que Ham√°s se rearme, lo que le permitir√≠a volver a cometer los horrores del 7 de octubre', declar√≥ el jueves su oficina. Al t√©rmino de su gira, Blinken subray√≥ que Washington se opone 'a una ocupaci√≥n a largo plazo de Gaza por parte de Israel'. El movimiento islamista exige la aplicaci√≥n del plan anunciado el 31 de mayo por Biden, que contempla una tregua de seis semanas junto a un retiro israel√≠ de las zonas densamente pobladas de Gaza y la liberaci√≥n de rehenes. En una segunda fase prev√© un retiro total israel√≠ del territorio palestino. Washington considera que un alto el fuego ayudar√≠a a evitar una conflagraci√≥n regional, incluyendo un posible ataque contra Israel por parte de Ir√°n y sus aliados, en represalia por el asesinato del jefe de Ham√°s el 31 de julio en Teher√°n, imputado al Estado hebreo. La guerra estall√≥ el 7 de octubre cuando combatientes de Ham√°s lanzaron un ataque en el que mataron a 1.199 personas en el sur de Israel, en su mayor√≠a civiles, seg√∫n un balance de AFP basado en cifras oficiales. Entre los muertos hab√≠a m√°s de 300 militares. Tambi√©n tomaron a 251 rehenes, de los cuales 105 contin√∫an en Gaza, incluidos 34 que el ej√©rcito declar√≥ muertos. El ej√©rcito israel√≠ afirm√≥ el jueves que encontr√≥ balas en los cuerpos de seis rehenes que recuper√≥ recientemente en un t√∫nel de Jan Yunis, en el sur de la Franja de Gaza, y a√±adi√≥ que estaba investigando las circunstancias de sus muertes. - 'Vivimos con miedo' - Netanyahu ha repetido que continuar√° la guerra hasta lograr la destrucci√≥n de Ham√°s, considerado como una organizaci√≥n terrorista por Israel, Estados Unidos y la Uni√≥n Europea. En respuesta al ataque del 7 de octubre, Israel lanz√≥ una ofensiva que ya ha dejado al menos 40.265 muertos en Gaza, seg√∫n el Ministerio de Salud de este territorio gobernado por Ham√°s desde 2007, que no detalla cu√°ntos son civiles o combatientes. Seg√∫n la ONU, la mayor√≠a son mujeres, adolescentes y ni√±os. La Defensa Civil del territorio palestino indic√≥ que cinco personas murieron el jueves en un bombardeo israel√≠ que golpe√≥ su viviendo en Jan Yunis. Testigos informaron de bombardeos en el centro y en el sur del territorio, adem√°s de enfrentamientos entre el ej√©rcito y combatientes palestinos en el norte. Tras un bombardeo israel√≠, una densa nube de humo negro cubri√≥ el campo de refugiados de Nuseirat, en el centro, donde los residentes huyeron a toda prisa entre el polvo y los escombros, seg√∫n im√°genes de AFPTV. 'Vivimos con miedo con nuestros hijos, los bombardeos no cesan nunca', declar√≥ Tahani Abu Cherbi a AFP en Deir al Balah, cerca de la zona de Nuseirat, de donde se niega a volver a desplazarse 'a pesar del peligro'.
